intro: Ternstroemia maguirei, commonly known as the Maguire's ternstroemia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Theaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern China and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical in shape with a smooth margin, and the flowers are borne in clusters, often in shades of white or pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
